title: I was worried about the build path change to BC Olafing Pantheon
body:
But then I realized something:

Just rush Brut like I would by default (unless in that situation before 5.8 I would get hexdrinker or Tiamat) then build kindlegem (because it's a very good idea to build Belt after Brutalizer pre5.8 so you are tanky and can teamfight more easily before you finish BC for mid game, which meaks it easier to finish Randuin's mid game) in place of Belt and just rush BC then. Then just build like normal and sell Brut for 6th item.

What this gives me:
an additional 15 AD and 20 more CDR at the cost of 180 health over pre5.8 BC + belt for the gold differential of roughly 300 gold

CDR on Panth is actually really useful. It means more stuns and thus more shields which means more survivability vs AA based comps. It also means more ults so now it's even better for teleporting and not just for initiating. And not to mention more E's which means easier times tank busting than before. Now, let me back up and say this is all just theory and that while useful, you wouldn't spam CDR on Panth more than pre5.8 BC because he needs damages and sticking power more.

That said, 35 CDR on Panth mid game is freaking amazing.

And I was also grumbling about Phage giving so much less offensive capability than I'm used to, but then I saw it had two uses:
1. I can rush it in a difficult lane without giving up too much offensive power
2. I can pair it with Brut if I am really stomping for BOTH hp and more offense.

So I'm starting to think this change isn't nearly as bad as I thought it would be.

The main downside I see is that it delays Randuin's or Glory, which is key on Pantheon if his team lacks catching or sticking power and makes him squishier longer (and I will be spamming Pantheon top/mid/jungle despite my team's comp in Ranked unless he is banned). Once he builds that Randuin's or Glory though, he's back at a net gain because then he would either be building something like Locket/BV or starting on LW with a pickaxe/LS. However, in the majority of ranked games I played in S4, games would end before I could finish my third item (some before finishing Randuin's, which is an issue). However, as the meta is now favoring bodyguarding and longer games, the early Brut+BC rush should help blow up squishies and being roughly as tanky as before while simultaneously having even better peeling and tankbusting capabilities.

Now that it's close to summertime, I can't wait to test this out in ranked.

replies.body: Brutalizer need another item apart of GhostBlade, because Ghostblade is not a item that every AD caster need.

Or any AD caster, really.  It has too much of its power tied up in AA-related stats like crit and AS active.

This is a good change for BC (and for Phage too for that matter), but it leaves Brutalizer in an awkward spot.  I hope they can work on this in a future patch.
Essense Reaver or Zeke Herald are good candidates to Brutalizer

The problem there is that we don't want people able to run 5 Armor Pen items.

Warrior (10)+ Ghostblade (20)+ BC (30%)+ LW (35%)+ New item(?)? It literally makes building armor meaningless because such an enormous part of it will be negated.

Warrior only the junglers can have so, effectively we only have a 4 items need a fourth item to complete all the roster of "ARMOR Pen"

Void Staff, Abyssal Scepter, Liandrys Torment, Sorcerer Shoes, AP actually have 4 mag pen, and AD only have 3 (Warrior can only be obtain by junglers so I don't take in account) BC, LW and GhostBlade, we need another Brutalizer final item to stay in the same "way" that the MR Pen items.

Essense Reaver or Zeke Herald are good items that can received the Brutalizer (both have CD and have a very low usage)
